A 33-year-old woman presents to the clinic with pain in her pelvic region. The doctor advises an ultrasound to investigate the cause and it shows a 10 cm, fluid-filled, ovarian cyst. The type of endometrial hyperplasia which has considerable morphological overlap with well differentiated adenocarcinoma is:

A 52-year-old woman presents to you in the outpatient department with a large abdominopelvic mass of about 30 weeks size. It has a heterogeneous appearance on ultrasound with solid and cystic components. The rest of the pelvis and abdomen appear normal. There is no ascites, the cancer antigen 125 level (CA) is raised to 430 units, she is asymptomatic. What is the best management option for this patient?

answers.option: Ultrasound guided aspiration of ovarian cyst fluid for cytology
Repeat scan and CA 125 levels after 3 months to check for interval changes
Debulking surgery including total abdominal hysterectomy, prophylactic bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, and lymphadenopathy

question: A 7-month-old child was brought to the outpatient department with a complaint of the absence of left testis in the scrotum since birth. On examination, the scrotum was empty on the left side and the testis is palpable in the inguinal canal. What should be the plan of treatment?

answers.option: Surgery should be performed around one year of age
Surgery should be deferred till puberty
Surgery is required after 2 years of age

question: The most common malignancy of breast is:

answers.option: Human papilloma virus screening and liquid base cytology

The ultrasound is normal. According to the patient, her maternal aunt had the same condition for which she underwent a hysterectomy. What is the most probable diagnosis?

On biopsy, there is an increased number of acini that are compressed and distorted in the central portion of the lesion, in a fibrous stroma. Preserved double layer of the epithelium is present in immunohistochemistry. No nuclear atypia is identified. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female presents with a palpable 4 cm lump in her breast. On mammography, microcalcifications are identified. On biopsy, proliferation of epithelial cells limited to ducts and lobules by the basement membrane is observed. These ducts have a central area of necrosis and the epithelial cells have pleomorphic, high-grade nuclei and mitotic activity. What is the most likely diagnosis?

It is the most common tumor in infants

question: A 23-year-old married female presents with the complaint of abrupt onset of heavy vaginal bleeding for the past 2 hours. Her husband gives the history that she missed 2 menstrual cycles and her pregnancy test is positive. Her Blood pressure is low and her pulse is weak and thready. Haemoglobin is low (6 g/dl). answers.option: Perform emergency surgery for ruptured ectopic pregnancy
Give her an appointment at the antenatal clinic near her home
Ask her to go home and drink plenty of fluids
Advise bedrest and call her for follow up in 2 weeks
Refer her to a general surgeon as she does not have a gynecological problem

question: A teenage male college student reports urinary frequency, dysuria, and clear urethral discharge. The routine culture was inconclusive. Which of the following is likely to explain his condition?

A 34-year-old woman presents with severe abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding. She had amenorrhea for 3 months. Her ultrasound shows a dilated fallopian tube. A provisional diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy is made. What can be expected on microscopy of the tube?

answers.option: Intermediate trophoblasts and a well-developed placenta
Hemorrhage necrosis and sheets of trophoblasts with atypia and mitosis

question: Which of the following statements is true regarding teratoma of the testes?

They are very common in adults

They commonly present with necrosis and hemorrhage

question: A 21-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of vaginal discharge. On per speculum examination, a red and inflamed cervix is seen. Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of pelvic inflammatory disease?

A 38-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal discharge that is brown in color. She also gives a history of a miscarriage that happened one year ago. answers.option: It needs continuous alpha fetoprotein level monitoring
It has a really poor prognosis after diagnosis
It has an excellant prognosis after evacuation and chemotherapy
The ovarian form of this tumor is less aggresive
The most common site for it's metastasis is the brain

question: A 23-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with complaints of vaginal bleeding and grape-like cysts passing through the vagina. She also states that she is 8 weeks pregnant. A karyotype of the cystic mass reveals a triploid karyotype. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 70-year-old woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of an increase in the frequency of micturition and excessive bloating. On pelvic examination, a mass can be felt. On further evaluation, she is found to have an ovarian tumor. On gross appearance, the tumor has multiple cystic lesions filled with serous fluid with papillary projections. Which of the following is the most appropriate regarding this tumor?

answers.option: Low parity is a risk reducing factor
It is associated with pseudomyxoma peritonei
Most likely to occur during the ages of 40-59

question: A 24-year-old lady presents to the clinic with a complaint of irregular menstrual cycles. If the cause of her irregular menstruation is anovulatory cycles, an ultrasound of the ovaries is likely to show which of the following cysts?

A 23-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of pain in her right breast. She also states that she gave birth 1 month ago and she is currently breastfeeding her baby. On examination, the woman is febrile and her breast is erythematous and tender. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 27-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of bloody discharge from her right nipple. On examination, she is afebrile, and a mass is palpable on her right breast. The doctor orders a mammogram which shows a solitary subareolar nodule with dilation of the ducts. A biopsy of the lesion shows a central fibrovascular core, extending from the walls of the duct, occupying the lumen and lined by myoepithelial cells. A 32-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of pain and swelling in her left breast. On examination, she is afebrile and a mass is palpable on her left breast. Biopsy of the lesion reveals an enlarged terminal duct lobular unit with compression and distortion of the acini. The acini are arranged in a swirling pattern. On examination, her breasts are non-tender, and no mass can be felt. The physician decides to get a biopsy done, which reveals tumor cells that are pleomorphic with high-grade nuclei, large central zones of necrosis, and calcifications that fill several ducts. Which of the following will present these morphological features on biopsy?

A biopsy reveals glomeruli-like structures and immunohistochemical staining is positive for alpha-fetoprotein. Which of the following statements is most appropriate regarding this tumor?

answers.option: It has a poor prognosis in infants and up to 3 years of age
It consists of sheets of undifferentiated cells with primitive glandular differentiation
The tumor cells consist of syncytiotrophoblast and cytotrophoblast cells
Glomeruli-like structures are called exner bodies
In adults it occurs along with embryonal carcinoma

question: Germ cell tumors are most commonly seen in which of the following age groups?
Serum alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) is elevated in which testicular tumor?

A 35-year-old male came to the clinic with a history of lower back pain, dysuria, and perineal and suprapubic discomfort. He recalls that he had recurrent dysuria in the past year which was treated. On examination, he has a tender prostate. His lab results show positive bacterial cultures. What is the suspected diagnosis?
Which of the following testicular tumors have raised placental alkaline phosphatase (PLAP) levels?
Which of the following is the most specific test for confirmation of suspected prostatic carcinoma?
Which of the following tumors has Schiller-Duval bodies that resemble primitive glomeruli?
What serum marker is diagnostic of prostate cancer?
The carcinoma of the prostate most commonly arises from which region of the prostate?
According to the new classification system, which one of the following options represents a low-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (LSIL)?
Which of the following is false about the morphology of seminoma?

answers.option: The tumor cells are typically positive for KIT, OCT3/4, and podoplanin and negative for cytokeratin on IHC
Seminoma lesion is composed of sheets of uniform cells divided into poorly demarcated lobules by delicate fibrous septa containing a lymphocytic infiltrate
Seminoma cell is round to polyhedral and has a distinct cell membrane
The classic seminoma cell has a granular cytoplasm along with a peripheral nucleus
Serum human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) levels are elevated

question: Which lesion of interlobular stroma of breast presents as a palpable mass that can be confused with carcinoma?
Which of the following epithelial breast lesions carries an increased risk of developing carcinoma?
Which of the following is the most common histologic type of breast cancer?
Which of the following statements regarding endometrial polyps is false?

answers.option: They may lead to endometrial carcinoma

question: Amongst the following, which cell type makes up germ cell tumors, especially seminoma?

answers.option: Tissue of the three germ layers

question: Which of the following microscopic features is not seen in seminoma?

answers.option: Cells growing in alveolar or tubular patterns sometimes with papillary convolutions
The lesions are composed of sheets of uniform cells divided into poorly demarcated lobules
Clear and watery appearing cytoplasm present in seminoma cells
Large, central nucleus with one or two prominent nuclei
Classic seminoma cells are large and round to polyhedral in shape

question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding the pathophysiology behind hemorrhagic infarction after testicular torsion?

A 72-year-old healthy male came to the clinic for his routine check-up. On digital rectal examination, a palpable firm nodule was noticed. A prostate biopsy was scheduled. The following results showed small, tightly packed glands containing cells with large nuclei and prominent nucleoli within. What could be the diagnosis of this patient?

A 28-year-old male comes to the hospital with scrotal pain. Upon physical examination, the upper pole of the right testicular region was tender and inflamed. Diagnosis of testicular inflammation was made. Which of the following statements best explains this disorder?

answers.option: Inflammation of epididymis is more common than testis
Orchitis is a complication in 80% cases of viral infection mumps
Non-specific orchitis is charcterized by caseous necrosis and granuloma formation
Principle immune cells infiltrate an inflamed testis including mast cells
Chronic case is associated with hyper-proliferation of seminiferous tubules

question: A 3-year-old girl is brought to the clinic by her parents. They noticed their daughter bleeding from her vagina. On physical examination, there are polyploid, grape-like masses protruding from the vagina. A biopsy specimen is examined under a microscope, and small round tumor cells are observed. The cells have oval nuclei, with small protrusions of cytoplasm from one end, resembling a tennis racket. Desmin is also visible on immunohistochemical staining. What will be the provisional diagnosis?
Elevated serum α-fetoprotein (AFP) is found in which type of testicular neoplasm?
Which of the following is an inappropriate option regarding sex cord-stromal tumors?

answers.option: The are not derived from coelomic epithelium

question: Anovulatory cycles are observed in which of the following pathology?
Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding differences between complete and partial moles?

answers.option: Edema of all villi in partial mole
Serum HCG highly elevated in complete mole
HCG in tissues in complete mole

question: A 65-year-old woman who has never had a child, noticed bloody vaginal discharge twice last month. She reached menopause 16 years ago. On physical examination, there is no abnormality in the size of the uterus nor any palpable adnexal masses are felt. There is no cervical erosion or any mass present. She is diabetic and hypertensive for the last 30 years. Her body mass index (BMI) is 30 kg/m^2. What will be her suspected diagnosis?

A 45-year-old woman comes to the clinic, presenting with vaginal bleeding. She reached menopause 4 years ago. On physical examination, no visible abnormality is noted. Her biopsy results depict endometrial adenocarcinoma, for which she undergoes total hysterectomy. Her uterus is of normal size but on one section there is a single 1.5 cm firm, tan-white, circumscribed subserosal nodule. What will be the suspected diagnosis of this patient?
Which one of the following is not a germ cell tumor?
Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding morphological changes in endometrial hyperplasia?

answers.option: Increased number and size of glands

question: Historically, the source of serous ovarian carcinomas was hypothesized to be which of the following?
What is the lining epithelium of glands in prostatic adenocarcinoma?

answers.option: Single layer of cuboidal or low columnar epithelium
Multiple layers of cuboidal or low columnar epithelium
Double layer of cuboidal or low columnar epithelium

question: A 23-year-old married lady presents with the complaint of repeated bouts of cyclical lower abdominal pain for the last 6 months. Ultrasound shows bilateral ovarian cysts, the largest one measuring 5 cm in diameter. The cyst is removed and sent for histopathology which shows a hemorrhagic cyst lined by hemosiderin-laden macrophages and luteinized granulosa cells. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 55-year-old lady presents with a 3-month history of postmenopausal bleeding, breast tenderness, and abdominal distension. Uterine curettage shows endometrial hyperplasia. Further investigations reveal a large ovarian mass which is surgically removed. Grossly, it is solid to cystic with a slightly yellow cut surface. Microscopy shows sheets of cells with “coffee bean” nuclei showing longitudinal grooves. The cells are forming follicle-like structures with central eosinophilic material. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old medical student is referred to your clinic with an ultrasound report showing a large right ovarian cyst measuring about 10 cm in diameter. The cyst is removed surgically and sent for histopathology. Cysts are unilocular and contain serous fluid. Microscopy shows a cyst lined by a single layer of columnar ciliated epithelium. Which of the following statements is true regarding this patient?

answers.option: Large solid areas are often found in this tumor
Serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma is implicated in pathogenesis
Most likely diagnosis is mucinous cyst adenocarcinoma
This tumor is classified as a surface epithelial tumor

question: Ovarian tumors are mostly benign and usually occur in young women. Which of the following statements is correct regarding ovarian tumors?

answers.option: Ovarian dysgerminoma is the counterpart of embryonal carcinoma in the testis
Endometriosis is implicated in pathogenesis of low grade epithelial tumors
Immature teratoma is the commonest type of germ cell tumor
Pseudomyxoma peritonei is a primary ovarian tumor
Mucinous tumors are bilateral in 80% of cases

question: A 35-year-old lady undergoes surgery for a large ovarian cyst. The cyst is unilocular and contains cheesy material, hair, and teeth. Microscopically, it is lined by skin with sebaceous glands and hair follicles. Other areas show mature fatty tissue, cartilage, and thyroid follicles. No primitive tissue is seen. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 2-year-old girl presents with an ovarian mass. Laboratory tests show a markedly raised level of alpha-fetoprotein. Microscopy of the growth shows a tumor composed of cuboidal cells in a lace-like pattern with numerous glomeruloid structures. Which of the following statements is true regarding this tumor?

answers.option: This is a type or teratoma
It usually has a benign course
In boys, this tumor is called a seminoma
Most likely diagnosis in this scenario is choriocarcinoma
Glomeruloid structures are called Schiller-Duval bodies

question: A 52-year-old, who is a mother of 6, presents to your clinic with a palpable mass just under the areola of her breast. She complains of thick, whitish secretions from her nipple. Biopsy shows dilated ducts filled with inspissated secretions and surrounded by foamy macrophages and marked chronic inflammation. Which of the following statements regarding this patient’s diagnosis is true?

answers.option: Squamous metaplasia of ducts is a prominent feature
Usually occurs in young lactating mothers

question: A 24-year-old male comes with complaints of swelling in the right testis for 6 months. On microscopic examination, components of germinal cell layers are recovered. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 33-year-old female comes with complaints of itching, discharge, and polypoidal growth on the vulva. On microscopic examination, there is a benign papillomatous squamous proliferation with a fibrovascular core. Keratinocytes show koilocytic changes. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 42-year-old female comes with complaints of itching, discharge, and polypoidal growth on the vulva. On microscopic examination, there is a benign papillomatous growth composed of mature squamous cells with raisinoid nuclei with a clear halo around nuclei. What is the most probable cause?

Most testicular germ cell tumors originate from precursor lesions called intratubular germ cell neoplasm/ germ cell neoplasm in situ. Which of the following tumors do not arise from intratubular germ cell neoplasm (ITGCN)?
A 20-year-old male came with swelling of left testis for 1 year. Based on morphology, spermatocytic seminoma can be differentiated from seminoma by the presence of which of the following?
Schiller-Duval bodies are characteristic features of which of the following?
Lichen sclerosis is associated with which one of the following?

A 38-year-old male presents with a unilateral painless palpable mass in the left testis. His serum alpha-fetoprotein and beta hcg levels are normal with mild lactate dehydrogenase elevation. On microscopic examination, it is composed of sheets of large monotonous cells with rounded nuclei with prominent nucleoli and eosinophilic cytoplasm. What would be the most typical first site of metastasis?
Which of the following is the most common genetic abnormality/ mutation observed in type 1 endometrioid carcinoma?
Which of the following is the most common signaling pathway responsible for endometrioid carcinoma?
What is the most probable pathological stage if the endometrial carcinoma is confined to the uterus?
Which type of mutation is present in 90% of serous endometrial carcinoma?

A 70-year-old healthy man has a routine check-up. On physical examination, a firm nodule is palpable in the prostate via digital rectal examination. An MRI scan confirms the presence and location of a posterior 0.4 cm nodule. Prostate biopsies are performed and microscopic examination shows small crowded glands containing cells with prominent nucleoli within the nuclei. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following statements is the most pertinent to prostate cancer?

answers.option: PSA>50 ng/mL is often associated with distant bone metastasis
65% of patients with Gleason score 5-7 will die from prostate cancer within 15 years
T2 describes a tumor that has extended through the capsule
Gleason score 4+3 describes a poorly differentiated tumor
Gleason score 3+4 is grade group 4 tumor

question: A 20-year-old woman has multiple sex partners. She has a fever and left lower quadrant abdominal pain with onset in association with her menstrual period since the last two cycles. The pap smear and culture show Neisseria gonorrhoeae growth. Diagnosis of gonococcal pelvic inflammatory disease is made. What is the common sequela of this infection?
A pediatrician finds urethral meatus on the undersurface of penis during examination of a newborn. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old male presents with a mass on the testis. Histopathology of the tumor reveals large multinucleated giant cells and mononuclear cells showing extensive hemorrhage and necrosis. What is the origin of these cells?

A 20-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of a painless palpable lump on her breast for the last 8 months. It is firm, mobile, and non-tender. What is the diagnosis of this case?

A 50-year-old female is found to have increased endometrial thickness. Biopsy of the tissue reveals an increased gland-to-stroma ratio with enlarged hyperchromatic nuclei showing complex stratifications. What is the likely diagnosis?

A young male smoker is incidentally found to have an undescended right testis. His father and uncle also had the same condition. What is the most important risk factor for germ cell tumors in his medical history?
A female patient presents to the clinic with an ulcer in the genital tract which is painless. She is found to have a sexually transmitted disease. What is the correct term for such lesions?

A young African female with multiple sexual partners presents to the clinic with dyspareunia and dysuria. On examination, she is found to have an ulcer in the genital tract which is tender and painful but not indurated. The physician suspects a chancroid. What is the causative organism of this lesion?
A young female presents with a painful rash in the genital tract. On examination, multiple painful vesicles are seen on the vulva. What is the diagnosis?

A couple presents to the clinic with a concern that they are unable to find one testis of their newborn. The doctor confirms the findings of the parents after examination. 30 years later, the man develops a urogenital tumor composed of sheets of uniform cells that has also spread to retro-peritoneal para-aortic lymph nodes. What is the most likely diagnosis of this tumor?

A 20-year-old male presents with a soft, rubbery growth on his testis. The tumor is homogenous, lobulated, and gray-white on the cut surface. Serological markers are negative. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 24-year-old married female presents with an erythematous subareolar mass. Examination reveals the formation of a fistula tract at the edge of the areola along with inflammation and scarring of the nipple. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of increased urinary frequency and urgency. Serum PSA levels are found to be >4.9 ng. Histopathology of the prostate confirms a tumor with Gleason Scores of 2+2(4) and 2+3(5). What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following testicular tumors contains both syncytiotrophoblasts and cytotrophoblasts?
Which of the following testicular tumors leads to the production of androgens and in some cases both androgens and estrogens and even corticosteroids?

A two-week-old neonate presented with a fever. Blood, urine, and CSF cultures were obtained. Urine culture sensitivity test, or urine CS showed a urinary tract infection. Which of the following is the most likely organism to grow in this neonate's urine culture?
Which of the following is not the consequence of hypospadias and epispadias?

answers.option: Increased risk of ascending urinary tract infections

question: Which of the following is not an environmental factor affecting testicular germ cell tumors?

answers.option: Exposure to pesticides and nonsteroidal estrogens

question: Which of the following features is true regarding ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS)?

answers.option: Clusters/nests of tumor cells with low nuclear grade floating in pools of extracellular mucin
Infiltrative nests of squamous cells with large cells having abundant cytoplasm
Neoplastic proliferation of mammary ductal epithelial cells confined to the duct without evidence of invasion through the basement membrane into the surrounding stroma
Infiltrative nests of tumor cells with moderately enlarged nuclei
Tumor cells arranged in Indian file pattern

question: Which of the following is not a prognostic factor for invasive ductal carcinoma?
What is a common causative microorganism associated with acute mastitis?
Which of the following is true regarding acute mastitis?

answers.option: Most common organism that is isolated is Streptococcus species
Abscesses may form as a complication if left untreated
Acute mastitis typically occurs in postmenopausal women

question: A 45-year-old woman presents with a 3 cm breast mass. An ultrasound-guided biopsy shows a fibroepithelial lesion. Which histologic feature is consistent with the diagnosis of fibroadenoma?

answers.option: Stromal mitotic activity (7-8/10 high power fields)

question: Which of the following is the most common malignant ovarian germ cell tumor?
Which of the following features is required for a diagnosis of endometrial hyperplasia?

answers.option: Glands with cribriforming architecture and cytologic alterations distinct from surrounding glands
Crowded glands with minimal residual intervening stroma
Documentation of a PTEN mutation or loss of PTEN by IHC

question: What clinical manifestations have most commonly been associated with functioning stroma in ovarian tumors?
Which histologic feature is diagnostic of endometritis in an endometrial biopsy?

answers.option: Fibrin, blood, and and acute inflammation
Proliferating blood vessels and presence of neutrophils
Cystic glands and presence of eosinophils

question: You are evaluating a 16-year-old boy for delayed puberty. His hormonal workup shows low levels of testosterone with raised LH and FSH. What is the most likely cause of delayed puberty?
Mammary duct ectasia is characterized by which of the following microscopic findings?

answers.option: Infiltrating ductal proliferation with desmoplastic stromal response
Proliferation of both stromal and glandular elements
Epithelial proliferation that fills and distends the terminal duct lobular units
Periductal inflammation and dilation of ducts, with foamy histiocytes within the luminal secretions and infiltrating the wall of ducts

question: In which of the following congenital anomalies there is complete or partial failure of intra-abdominal testes to descend into the scrotal sac and is associated with testicular dysfunction and increased risk of testicular cancer?
